Provenance: sale, Paillet, Paris, April 5, 1809, no. 9, as "Rome antique" and "Rome moderne," each 64 x 74 pouces [68 x 77 in.], purchased by Paillet before auction for Fr 2,801)
posthumous sale, Paris, June 2, 1814, no. 47, as "Rome antique" and "Rome moderne", each 64 x 72 pouces, for Fr 1,000]
sale, Christie's, March 17, 1877, no. 115, "Ancient Rome," £152.5.0 to Lesser
sale, Galerie Charpentier, Paris, March 21, 1952, nos. 87 ["Rome Antique," 52.63.1] and 88 ["Rome au Temps de la Renaissance," 52.63.2], to Cailleux for MMA)
